Issues.Title: In SSR mode the HTTP POST cache should consider cases when the body is an object
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description This is a similar issue as the described and solved in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/54377 . The problem is that usually, we can provide an object as the `body` and this should be normal as the body will still be serialized later in the http POST method. I understand that this could have performance implications while serializing the body each time we want to obtain the cache key so not sure if this would be accepted to add although it should be desired. Not sure if it would be a good solution, but could we maybe add another option to the POST requests to provide a cache key function or extra string? ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true No exception, just that two different POST requests with different body params get the same cache key. ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 17.2.3 Node: 20.11.0 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "In SSR mode the HTTP POST cache should consider cases when the body is an object" (#54956)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): Provide scheduler for use and coordination with zone change detection
Issues.Body:
This commit makes the zoneless scheduler (privately) available to applications that have ZoneJS-based change detection. This would catch any changes of interest (signal updates, `markForCheck` calls, attaching `Dirty` views) that happen outside the Angular Zone.

See #53844 for additional information about why this is important. More details to come in the a future commit that makes this a public option.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): Provide scheduler for use and coordination with zone change detection" (#54952)

Issues.Title: Angular.Dev Docs: First App Tutorial - Page 04, Step 4.4 - Image isn't found at provided image source url.
Issues.Body: ### Describe the problem that you experienced The following code is provided within First App Tutorial Page 4, Step 4.4. ```ts ... // Existing @Component Code export class HomeComponent { readonly baseUrl = 'https://angular.dev/assets/tutorials/common'; // Problem is here housingLocation: HousingLocation = { id: 9999, name: 'Test Home', city: 'Test city', state: 'ST', photo: `${this.baseUrl}/example-house.jpg`, // Problem is here availableUnits: 99, wifi: true, laundry: false, }; } ``` The combination of the baseURL and the example-house does not point to an actual resource (https://angular.dev/assets/tutorials/common/example-house.jpg). Therefore, within Page 07, Step 1.2 the instantiated HousingLocation component does not display an image. ### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem https://angular.dev/tutorials/first-app/04-interfaces ### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation The correct path to the image location that exists. Unsure what this path should be. ### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem Following the tutorial within my own local environment. ### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem For tutorial resources, like this image source, to be the correct path. Angular.io docs have the following image in the same step: https://angular.io/assets/images/tutorials/faa/example-house.jpg ### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem ### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here _No response_ ### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version _No response_ ### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can _No response_

Issues.Body: This commit refactors the router module to enhance performance by substituting the startsWith method with direct access `[0]` when verifying the value of a single character. This optimization improves efficiency, as direct access retrieves the character's value stored at a specific index in the string, resulting in slightly faster execution.

Issues.Title: fix(core): `ComponentFixture` stability should match `ApplicationRef`
Issues.Body:
This change aligns the stability of `ComponentFixture` with that of `ApplicationRef`, preventing confusing differences between the two as more APIs start using the `PendingTasks` that may not be tracked by `NgZone`.

BREAKING CHANGE: `ComponentFixture.whenStable` now matches the `ApplicationRef.isStable` observable. Prior to this change, stability of the fixture did not include everything that was considered in `ApplicationRef`. `whenStable` of the fixture will now include unfinished router navigations and unfinished `HttpClient` requests. In addition, `ComponentFixture.isStable` would synchronously switch to true in some scenarios but will now always be asynchronous.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): `ComponentFixture` stability should match `ApplicationRef`" (#54949)

Issues.Title: Missing `tbody` in HTML thows a hydration missmatch error.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When a template has a table without a `tbody` node, browsers adds them dynamincally. 

This throws a hydration missmatch error. 

The workaround is obvious : adding the `tbody` after the `table` node. 

* Should we produce a template warning here ? 
* There are probably other cases where browsers dynamically change the dom when loading the HTML. Should have a more global approach on this.

Issues.Title: Explicitly set ControlConfig as the parameter object's value type on FormBuilder#group
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Submitting this as a feature but it could be considered a bug depending on your point-of-view.

On the `FormBuilder` service, there is the method `group` which has a myriad of people reporting GitHub bugs that aren't actually bugs, especially related to when a control's type is an array due to the less-than-intuitive nature of the syntax.

That method immediately calls the internal method `_reduceControls` which correctly constrains the type of its parameter `controls` to be: `{ [k: string]: T | ControlConfig<T> | FormControlState<T> | AbstractControl<T> }`. However, the input on the `group` method parameter named `controls` only has the constraint `{ [key: string]: any }` which is far more permissive but also far more error prone by end-users.

### Proposed solution

It'd be extremely beneficial for one of the two following solutions, with my heavy preference being on the first:

1. Update the input of `FormBuilder#group` to match that of `FormBuilder#_reduceControls` as described above.
2. Explain in either the API documentation for `FormBuilder#group` that the `any` should actually be `{ [k: string]: T | ControlConfig<T> | FormControlState<T> | AbstractControl<T> }` but is left as `any` for backwards compatibility. Then after an appropriate amount of time and deprecation notices, apply suggestion 1.

### Alternatives considered

Only real alternative for people to figure out all possible values of `group` is to read every single part of the Reactive Forms page and hope that they covered it all. From my looking, never once was `ControlConfig<T>` mentioned in any documentation.

I'm assuming that part of the reason `ControlConfig<T>` is avoided in the documentation because it causes bug reports such as the one in #48631, but as the old adage goes, "security through obscurity is not security."

I know that pinging devs directly is probably discouraged, but I want to make sure that @dylhunn sees this since he appears to be the most active participant in the various issues I checked before opening this ticket.

Issues.Title: toSignal does not unsubscribe when combined with shareReplay
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Recently I have found a strange error when using the built-in `toSignal` function from the `@angular/core/rxjs-interop` package. 

Everything works as expected unless the source observable has an additional `shareReplay` operator.

When `shareReplay` is used, the signal stays subscribed to the observable, even after the component is destroyed.  

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-16-starter-3ew8m4

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
When I use the `tap` operator on the source observable + `shareReplay` operator, I will still see the console logs even after the component is destroyed (if the observable is emitting new values).
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

When inspecting the provided stackblitz page, please open the console and look for logs. Once the toggle button is pressed, the component should be destroyed, and the logs should no longer appear. However, if the `shareReplay` operator is present, the logs continue to appear.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "toSignal does not unsubscribe when combined with shareReplay" (#54927)

The labels of the Sass preprocessor stylesheet option values have been updated for the `application` schematic's `style` option. The labels now provide greater clarity regarding the preprocessor tool used for both the SCSS (more common) and indented Sass syntaxes.

```
? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? (Use arrow keys)

  Sass (Indented) [ https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax#the-indented-syntax ]

```

Issues.Title: [ng new]: define main as inital branch name or make it configurable
Issues.Body:
### Command

new

### Description

**background:**
* When you have a fresh installed system and not yet configured the main branch it  will use master and git complains about using "master" as branch name.
* discovered while preparing the ngGirls workshop, so it would be awesome to not have another command to avoid this warning.

to follow these best practises of e.g. using main, it would be awesome, when the following command

```
npx @angular/cli@latest new todo-list
```

is executed.

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/6207308/9db1042d-94bd-47e9-87af-eb0a6c6a2e9e)


### Describe the solution you'd like

* creating by default a "main" branch
* make an option to choose the initial branch

### Describe alternatives you've considered

configure git branch like written, but for beginners it would be easier to skip this step
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[ng new]: define main as inital branch name or make it configurable" (#27313)

Issues.Title: add option to exit ng serve on error
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

right now we are facing a big problem in our e2e pipeline because of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/27167
it's even worse when it happen with serve than build, because it doesn't exit and the e2e never run and the pipeline stuck for hours till someone notice it and kill it manually or it timeout
it's wasting us a lot of time and resources, at least it should exit when it fails

### Describe the solution you'd like

add option similar to `--exit-on-error` or even better a production flag `--ci` so that it disable the watch for file changes, make it exit on error and do any needed optimization for this use case

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I can't think of any
if someone has a workaround for this please share
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "add option to exit ng serve on error" (#27309)

Issues.Title: ng update - Migration failed: Unexpected token  in JSON at position 0
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Command: `ng update @angular/core@15 @angular/cli@15 @angular/material@15 --allow-dirty --verbose`
Output:
`Repository is not clean. Update changes will be mixed with pre-existing changes.
Locating potential npmrc files:
Trying 'C:\Users\alex.s\.npmrc'...found.
The installed Angular CLI version is outdated.
Installing a temporary Angular CLI versioned 15.2.10 to perform the update.
‚úî Packages successfully installed.
Repository is not clean. Update changes will be mixed with pre-existing changes.
Using package manager: npm
Collecting installed dependencies...
Found 61 dependencies.
NPM 7+ detected -- enabling force option for package installation
Fetching dependency metadata from registry...
Locating potential npmrc files:
Trying 'C:\Users\user\.npmrc'...found.
√ó Migration failed: Unexpected token  in JSON at position 0
  See "C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\ng-bDvaNK\angular-errors.log" for further details.`
  
  `[error] SyntaxError: Unexpected token Ôªø in JSON at position 0
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at _buildPackageInfo (C:\Users\alex.s\AppData\Local\Temp\angular-cli-packages-sMhQUt\node_modules\@angular\cli\src\commands\update\schematic\index.js:430:30)
    at C:\Users\alex.s\AppData\Local\Temp\angular-cli-packages-sMhQUt\node_modules\@angular\cli\src\commands\update\schematic\index.js:710:53
    at Map.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at C:\Users\alex.s\AppData\Local\Temp\angular-cli-packages-sMhQUt\node_modules\@angular\cli\src\commands\update\schematic\index.js:709:27
    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
    at async callRuleAsync (C:\Users\alex.s\AppData\Local\Temp\angular-cli-packages-sMhQUt\node_modules\@angular-devkit\schematics\src\rules\call.js:78:18)
`

The issue happens because of some package's package.json file has encoding different from UTF-8. In my case that was a package with UTF-8 with BOM encoding.

### Resolution
Find that package (possibly by trying all), open package.json file from that package in node_modules and re-save it with UTF-8.


Maybe it is fixed in future versions. Creating issue with resolution, so maybe it will help someone struggling 

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Assuming you have Angular 14 project
2. Add some package to you package.json with UTF-8 with BOM encoding package.json. Or modify some package.json manually in node_modules
3. run command `ng update @angular/core@15 @angular/cli@15 @angular/material@15 --allow-dirty --verbose`

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid transforming empty component stylesheets
Issues.Body: A stylesheet for a component that is empty or contains only whitespace will no longer be transformed and bundled during a build. Transforming the stylesheet was unnecessary work as an empty string would be returned as a result. While this may not be common in applications, it is a possibility. Both file and inline component stylesheets are affected by this change.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid transforming empty component stylesheets" (#27293)

Issues.Title: import * as _ from "lodash"; seems to fail at runtime after upgrade to 17.3
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

17.2.3

### Description

In the process of upgrading an application to Angular 17.3 and I ran into an issue with our lodash imports no longer working properly when using the form; `import * as _ from "lodash";`
Our current setup does not currently use the `allowSyntheticDefaultImports` or `esModuleInterop` compilerOptions.

The error doesn't appear in the IDE.
At runtime, when using lodash, all of the methods appear undefined;

```
  ngOnInit() {
    // üëá Is crashing in 17.3; ERROR TypeError: _.isEqual is not a function
    if (_.isEqual(1, 1)) {
      console.log('lodash * as _ is working');
      this.lodashWorking.set(true);
    }
  }
```

From what I can tell, they appear to be located under `_.default.` instead. So `_.default.isEqual(1,1)` would work at runtime but not in the IDE.

### Minimal Reproduction

Here's a repo where the issue occurs on 17.3; https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-y33pan?file=src%2Fmain.ts

The same code with Angular 17.2.3 is working; https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-nlgc6a?file=src%2Fmain.ts


### Exception or Error

```text
main.ts:5 ERROR TypeError: _.isEqual is not a function
    at _AppComponent.ngOnInit (app.component.ts:21:13)
    at callHookInternal (core.mjs:5136:14)
    at callHook (core.mjs:5163:13)
    at callHooks (core.mjs:5118:17)
    at executeInitAndCheckHooks (core.mjs:5068:9)
    at refreshView (core.mjs:12351:21)
    at detectChangesInView$1 (core.mjs:12560:9)
    at detectChangesInViewWhileDirty (core.mjs:12277:5)
    at detectChangesInternal (core.mjs:12259:9)
    at detectChangesInView (core.mjs:31605:5)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 17.3.0
Node: 18.18.0
Package Manager: npm 10.2.3
OS: linux x64

Angular: 17.3.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1703.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   17.3.0
@angular-devkit/core            17.3.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      17.3.0
@schematics/angular             17.3.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.3.3
zone.js                         0.14.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

If we enable either `allowSyntheticDefaultImports` or `esModuleInterop` and use the import form `import _ from "lodash";`. It works as expected but it was surprising that a minor upgrade of Angular would change this behavior.
I wonder if it's an intentional change and if Angular expects us to use those flags / import style only.

Also unsure if it's a cli/builder issue or something from the angular compiler. 
The closest recent issue I could see was a fix(complier-cli) which does touch on imports and defaults but I am unsure if it's relevant [#53695](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/53695)

Let me know if I need to recreate the issue in the main angular repository instead.

Issues.Title: application builder doesn't build a package that includes optionally node packages (fabric)
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

the "browser" builder in the same version

### Description

when using the 'fabric' npm package (https://www.npmjs.com/package/fabric) and use that in your package then with the new application builder this won't build anymore,
With the browser builder this builds fine that seems to just ignore the optional stuff (or stuff that is not really used?)

[fabric.zip](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/files/14605058/fabric.zip)

unzip this package and run npm install and then npm run build
this will fail
if then the application builder is changed to browser (browser property to  main ) then it does build fine.

unzip
npm install
npm run build

Issues.Title: docs-bug(COMPONENT): <mat-radio-group> is compatible with @angular/forms...where "compatible" means "requires"
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

The radio button documentation says: 

> Use with `@angular/forms`
> `<mat-radio-group>` is compatible with `@angular/forms` and supports both FormsModule and ReactiveFormsModule.

"Use with" is accurate but unclear; and, "compatible" is accurate but even less clear. The current _radio button_ implementation **requires** `@angular/forms`; it simply does not compile without it, so express that clearly, perhaps:

> Requires `@angular/forms`
> `<mat-radio-group>` requires `@angular/forms` and supports both FormsModule and ReactiveFormsModule. 

It's unfortunate that the radio button requires `@angular/forms` but that's an design and/or implementation issue.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/radio/overview
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "docs-bug(COMPONENT): <mat-radio-group> is compatible with @angular/forms...where "compatible" means "requires"" (#28736)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/listbox): improve SSR compatibility by adding an _isBrowser check before calling _setPreviousActiveOptionAsActiveOptionOnWindowBlur
Issues.Body:
This PR addresses the `ReferenceError: window is not defined` error that gets thrown when the CDK Listbox is rendered on the server.

The `_setPreviousActiveOptionAsActiveOptionOnWindowBlur` method in the `CdkListbox` class uses RxJS' `fromEvent` with `window` as its target. This is problematic when the application is being rendered on the server, since `_setPreviousActiveOptionAsActiveOptionOnWindowBlur` is called in the constructor.

The solution is to add a simple `_isBrowser` property that leverages the `Platform` API and a check in the constructor before calling `_setPreviousActiveOptionAsActiveOptionOnWindowBlur`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/listbox): improve SSR compatibility by adding an _isBrowser check before calling _setPreviousActiveOptionAsActiveOptionOnWindowBlur" (#28746)

Issues.Title: bug(DragDropModule): Dependency Injection issue with CdkDrag combined with CdkVirtualScroll after upgrade
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

17.2.1

### Description

I think the changes in [PR 28633](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/28633) (a fix for #28614) may have caused a dependency injection issue when combining virtual scroll and drag and drop. I've setup a very minimal StackBlitz example to show the issue here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/f2xpkk. If you load the example as it is currently with version 17.2.2, you'll see the following stack trace:
vendor.js:47027 ERROR NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(Standalone[CdkVirtualScrollAppendOnlyExample])[InjectionToken CDK_DRAG_PARENT -> InjectionToken CDK_DRAG_PARENT -> InjectionToken CDK_DRAG_PARENT]:
NullInjectorError: No provider for InjectionToken CDK_DRAG_PARENT!
at NullInjector.get (vendor.js:44290:21)
at R3Injector.get (vendor.js:44741:27)
at R3Injector.get (vendor.js:44741:27)
at R3Injector.get (vendor.js:44741:27)
at ChainedInjector.get (vendor.js:55693:32)
at lookupTokenUsingModuleInjector (vendor.js:46282:31)
at getOrCreateInjectable (vendor.js:46328:10)
at …µ…µdirectiveInject (vendor.js:49755:17)
at …µ…µinject (vendor.js:43467:59)
at inject (vendor.js:43550:10

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/f2xpkk
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the StackBlitz and see the console error
2. If you update all the Angular versions in the package file to 17.2.1 and reload, the error is no longer present


### Expected Behavior

No stack trace error and page loads successfully

### Actual Behavior

Console errors about dependency injection prevent the component from loading completely

### Environment

- Angular: 17.2.2 (and 17.3.0)
- CDK/Material: 17.2.2 (and 17.3.0)
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(DragDropModule): Dependency Injection issue with CdkDrag combined with CdkVirtualScroll after upgrade" (#28744)

Issues.Title: bug(MatCalendar): updating dateClass does not update calendar view
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We have displayed a calendar and when changing the month we load data from the backend to highlight certain cells.

We tried to update the `dateClass` using observables together with the async pipe which did not work since the calendar is not updating when the reference changes.

A workaround was to call `setLocale` of the date adapter which triggers a rerender.

I consider this a bug and not a feature because it is not mentioned anywhere that this cannot be done and `dateFilter` also can be updated asynchronously.

### Reproduction

### Expected Behavior

Update calendar view on `dateClass` change

### Actual Behavior

calendar view does not update when `dateClass` changes.
